episodes.title: Panel: How MAGA turned on Trump & Bondi over Epstein files
episodes.description:
The "Table For Five" panel breaks down MAGA's angry response to President Donald Trump and Attorney General Pam Bondi over their handling of the Epstein files.

episodes.title: Goldman Sachs' top lawyer resigns over Epstein files
episodes.description:
Kathy Ruemmler, the chief legal officer at Goldman Sachs, said she is resigning amid fallout from the Justice Department’s release of millions of pages of Jeffrey Epstein documents.

episodes.title: Epstein files: Bondi, Democrats trade insults during combative hearing
episodes.description:
Attorney General Pam Bondi testified at a heated House Judiciary Committee hearing amid ongoing controversies related to the Jeffrey Epstein files release, investigation into President Donald Trump’s political foes and the handling of the fatal shootings of two US citizens in Minnesota by immigration enforcement officers. 

Bondi’s first hour of testimony was combative, devolving into personal attacks on Democrats and screaming matches over whose turn it is to speak. Bondi called Rep. Jamie Raskin – a former constitutional law professor and the top Democrat on the House Judiciary Committee – a “washed up loser lawyer,” as the clash between her and committee Democrats escalated over her approach to their questions.

For live updates, visit: https://cnn.it/3MhMWr5

0:00 Rep. Jayapal asks Bondi to apologize to Epstein victims
1:42 Bondi praises President Trump
2:06 "You don't tell me anything, you washed up loser lawyer"
2:20 Rep. Massie tells Bondi he caught her "red-handed" over Epstein files redaction
2:45 "This is a fiasco": Legal expert blasts Bondi's testimony
4:42 "This is farcical. And it's embarrassing": Reacting to Bondi's testimony
8:12 Bondi was testifying for an audience of one

Watch more CNN here: https://cnn.it/4kh5RPe

#PamBondi #HouseJudiciaryCommittee #News

episodes.title: Epstein files: Ghislaine Maxwell refuses to testify, pleads fifth
episodes.description:
Ghislaine Maxwell has invoked her Fifth Amendment rights against self-incrimination in her ongoing deposition with the House Oversight Committee, according to a person familiar with the matter. 

Maxwell, Jeffrey Epstein’s accomplice, appeared before the panel virtually. She is currently serving time at a minimum security prison in Bryan, Texas. 

00:00 House Oversight Committee chairman speaks about Ghislaine Maxwell’s deposition 
2:53 Maxwell’s attorney said she would answer the committee’s questions after being granted clemency 
4:24 Chairman Comer talks about scheduled depositions with Bill and Hillary Clinton  
6:54 Should Ghislaine Maxwell be granted clemency? 

Watch more CNN here: https://cnn.it/4kh5RPe

#JeffreyEpstein #GhislaineMaxwell #News

episodes.title: Epstein files: Drafts expose Bill Gates, Jeffrey Epstein relationship details
episodes.description:
Billionaire Bill Gates faces fresh scrutiny for Epstein ties following Justice Department’s document release. The documents include the names of numerous high-profile men who interacted with Epstein — who died by suicide in 2019 awaiting trial on federal sex-trafficking charges — a list that also included Trump, former President Bill Clinton, Elon Musk and the former Prince Andrew, among many others. All have denied any wrongdoing related to Epstein and have never been charged by law enforcement with any crimes.

0:00 KFILE on drafts allegedly written by Jeffrey Epstein
1:51 Bill Gates and Jeffey Epstein emails
6:11 Details from Epstein files reveal prominent individuals
6:52 Brad Karp's emails with Jeffrey Epstein
8:21 Steve Bannon's friendly texts

Watch more CNN here: https://cnn.it/4kh5RPe

#EpsteinFiles #BillGates #News

episodes.title: Epstein files rock UK as Clintons strike last-minute deal to testify
episodes.description:
The US government’s release of more than 3 million documents related to Jeffrey Epstein has raised further questions about the ties of some prominent figures in British public life to the disgraced financier, who appears to have been granted access to the heart of Britain’s government and royal family. British Prime Minister Keir Starmer has urged the former Prince Andrew, now Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, to testify before the US Congress, while former British ambassador to the United States Peter Mandelson, who resigned from the Labour Party on Sunday, is set to quit the House of Lords on Wednesday.

Bill and Hillary Clinton will appear for depositions later this month in the House of Representatives’s Jeffrey Epstein probe, putting an end to the contempt of Congress proceedings against them and setting up high-stakes interviews.

0:00 Epstein files fallout extends to UK
1:05 CNN royal correspondent reports from London
2:00 British ex-Ambassador to US steps down from House of Lords
3:19 Clintons agree to Epstein deposition, avoiding contempt vote
4:07 Deputy AG: "It is not a crime to party with Mr. Epstein"
4:29 The Atlantic reporter on Epstein files fallout

Watch more CNN here: https://cnn.it/4kh5RPe

#EpsteinFiles #Clintons #Andrew

episodes.title: DOJ says it found a million more docs potentially related to Epstein
episodes.description:
The Justice Department on Wednesday said it has uncovered over a million more documents potentially related to the Jeffrey Epstein case and may need “a few more weeks” to process and release them to the public. 

The department made the revelation in a post on X, saying the the US Attorney for the Southern District of New York and the FBI had informed the department of the new documents.

00:00 Breaking news report on newly discovered files related to Jeffrey Epstein 
00:25 CNN crime and justice correspondent reports on newly discovered documents 
03:46 Ranking Democrat from the House Oversight Committee responds 
04:30 CNN Senior White House reporter live from West Palm Beach, Florida 

 #JeffreyEpstein #EpsteinFiles #News

episodes.title: Trump’s name appears in latest release of Epstein files
episodes.description:
President Donald Trump’s name has appeared in the latest Epstein files drop — including in references to flight records related to Epstein’s private plane. Authorities have not accused Trump of criminal wrongdoing related to Epstein.  

00:00 Report on the Justice Department releasing more of the Jeffrey Epstein files

episodes.title: Growing outrage over release of heavily redacted Epstein files
episodes.description:
The Department of Justice announced that it will continue reviewing and redacting materials from the thousands of files related to accused sex-trafficker Jeffrey Epstein that have been released since Friday. 

The announcement comes after an image containing a photo of President Donald Trump appears to have been removed from the Department of Justice’s “Epstein Library.” 

00:00 Report on redactions in Epstein files release 
01:15 Legal expert weighs in on the Epstein files release 
00:50 Democratic lawmaker responds to the DOJ’s handling of the Epstein files 

 #JeffreyEpstein  #EpsteinFiles #News

episodes.title: 'Release all the files': DOJ withheld more Epstein files than law requires
episodes.description:
The DOJ’s redactions of the files are vast – and the reasons for them go beyond what the law requires. In some cases, entire pages are redacted. To comply with the law, several redactions had to be made, according to the DOJ. Information redacted, Deputy Attorney General Todd Blanche said, included any material that contained personally identifiable information of victims, child sexual abuse materials, classified national defense or foreign policy information, or would jeopardize an active investigation.

0:00 Erin Burnett OutFront
2:52 MJ Lee reports
5:34 The panel discusses

#Epsteinfiles #DepartmentofJustice #News

episodes.title: 'So many questions': Epstein survivor, lawmaker react to file release
episodes.description:
The Epstein Files Transparency Act required the Department of Justice to release files related to the late convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein by today. At around 4 p.m. ET today, the Justice Department released some of the documents. CNN's Jake Tapper hosts Annie Farmer, a Jeffrey Epstein survivor, as well as Rep. Robert Garcia to discuss the recent wave of newly released Epstein-related documents by the Department of Justice.

0:00 Epstein survivor Annie Farmer
6:56 Rep. Garcia reacts

#Epsteinfiles #DepartmentofJustice #News

episodes.title: Judge allows release of Ghislaine Maxwell court documents
episodes.description: A federal judge in New York on Tuesday granted the Justice Department’s request to unseal records from the investigation and criminal prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. The ruling from Judge Paul Engelmayer opens the door for the department to publicly release evidence it had gathered against Maxwell, an associate of sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.  #CNN #News

episodes.title: 'What's going on here?': Gloria Allred, attorney for 27 Epstein survivors, on new email release
episodes.description: Attorney Gloria Allred speaks with CNN News Central's John Berman about how survivors are reacting to what she calls 'piecemeal' revelations in the Epstein case.  #CNN #News

episodes.title: Virginia Giuffre's family reacts to Andrew being stripped of 'prince' title
episodes.description: Sky and Amanda Roberts, brother and sister-in-law of Epstein survivor Virginia Giuffre, reacts to King Charles stripping Andrew of his "Prince" title and evicting him from his royal mansion.  #CNN #News

episodes.title: Prince Andrew to be stripped of ‘prince’ title and evicted from royal mansion
episodes.description: Britain’s King Charles has started a process to strip Prince Andrew of his titles and given him notice to move out of his mansion, Buckingham Palace said Thursday. It comes as Prince Andrew has failed to quell the scandal over his association with disgraced financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.    #CNN #News

episodes.title: 'Smacks of a cover up': Epstein, Maxwell accusers react with 'horror and outrage' on prison transfer
episodes.description: Family members of Virginia Giuffre — one of the women who accused Epstein of sex trafficking and who died by suicide earlier this year — and other accusers of Epstein and Maxwell reacted to the news with “horror and outrage,” saying that it “smacks of a cover up.” #CNN #News

episodes.title: Family of Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre wants files released
episodes.description: CNN’s Kaitlan Collins speaks with the family of Virginia Giuffre, one of Jeffrey Epstein’s sex-trafficking accusers. The family wants all Epstein files to be released saying that Virginia Giuffre wanted the files to be released. #CNN #News

episodes.title: Jan. 6 rioter refusing pardon: 'I never realized a president could become a cult leader'
episodes.description: Pam Hemphill, known as ex-“MAGA Granny,” is a convicted January 6th participant who served two months in federal prison. She explains why she doesn’t want the pardon from President Trump. #CNN #News

episodes.title: Persuadable Episode 2: How to help someone who’s down a conspiracy theory rabbit hole | The Account
episodes.description:
If someone you love has fallen deep into conspiracy theory belief, what can you do? Dr. Joe Pierre is a Health Sciences Clinical Professor in the Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences at the University of California, San Francisco and the author of a new book, “False: How Mistrust, Disinformation, and Motivated Reasoning Make Us Believe Things that Aren't True.” He speaks with CNN’s Donie O’Sullivan about how to approach a tough discussion with a loved one who’s down the rabbit hole and why the stakes for this issue feel so high right now.

Listen to the full episode of Persuadable on CNN’s The Account podcast: https://link.chtbl.com/793y7L3w

#cnn #news

episodes.title: 'I was screaming': Diddy accuser recounts alleged assault in first-ever interview
episodes.description: A John Doe filed a civil suit against Sean “Diddy” Combs, accusing him of sexual assault at a “White Party” while Doe was employed by a private security firm. In an exclusive interview with CNN, Doe tells his story for the first time.  #CNN #News

episodes.title: See what happens when Trump supporter talks to CNN reporter about the Constitution
episodes.description: CNN’s Donie O’Sullivan speaks to a Trump supporter while reporting on the surge of misinformation in the United States. The full episode, “MisinfoNation: The Trump Faithful,” airs on CNN’s The Whole Story with Anderson Cooper. #CNN #News

episodes.title: The case of the predator priest: Abuse and scandal in the Catholic Church (2019)
episodes.description: CNN’s Nima Elbagir examines allegations of rape, abuse, and cover-ups in the Catholic Church in this 2019 documentary.  #CNN #News

episodes.title: Surviving a cult: How 30 people escaped the Jim Jones murder-suicide (2012)
episodes.description: More than 900 people died the day Rev. Jim Jones forced his church followers into a mass murder-suicide in his remote settlement in Guyana, but 30 people were able to survive by defying Jones and fleeing. A 2012 CNN Special Report explored their stories of desperation and remarkable will to survive. #CNN #News

episodes.title: Ex-Scientologist Leah Remini speaks out after Danny Masterson sentencing
episodes.description: Actress and former Scientologist Leah Remini speaks with CNN's Jake Tapper about the sentencing of actor and Scientologist Danny Masterson, who was convicted on two counts of rape earlier this year. The Church of Scientology has denied allegations it harassed Masterson's accusers. Remini has filed a lawsuit against the organization claiming years of harassment, but the group has also denied her allegations. #CNN #News

episodes.title: Lawmaker shot at Jonestown compares Trump to cult leader Jim Jones
episodes.description:
Rep. Jackie Speier (D-CA), who was shot by members of the Peoples Temple during the 1978 Jonestown Massacre, says she sees similarities between cult leader Jim Jones and former President Donald Trump in the way they use their charisma to connect with disillusioned American and act as "merchants of deceit." Speier was shot five times on an airstrip in Guyana while accompanying a lawmaker to investigate the nearby cult.
#ReliableSources #CNN #News

episodes.title: What is Scientology?
episodes.description: Religious scholar Reza Aslan explores the origin and central ideas of Scientology, the new American religion founded by L. Ron Hubbard. "Believer" airs every Sunday at 10p ET.

episodes.title: Scientology leader's niece speaks out
episodes.description: Jenna Miscavige Hill talks to CNN's Piers Morgan about her uncle, David Miscavige.

episodes.title: World's Untold Stories: Secrets & Sins
episodes.description: This is a documentary about  the first victim of clerical sexual abuse in Ireland  to go public with their story  It also shows why Pope Francis' had to chastise  bishops who covered up abuse by priests in their dioceses. The half hour CNNI show World's Untold Stories, produced by Andrew Tkach and editor Scott McGhee, also examines how errant priests were protected by the church and exported to other countries, including the United States.

episodes.title: CNN: Escape from Jonestown
episodes.description: CNN Presents: "Escape from Jonestown" premiered on Nov. 13, 2008 In 1978, 909 Americans were led to mass murder-suicide by Rev. Jim JonesOne-third of the dead at Jonestown were children; only 33 people survived CNN special correspondent Soledad O'Brien reports on untold stories of survivors
